intro: Malleola bicruris, commonly known as the two-winged malleola, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive two-winged structure on its fruit, which aids in wind dispersal. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Despite its rarity, Malleola bicruris plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for specific insect species.
